title: Can we do an M.Ed after a B.E? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hi No, you can’t directly go for M. Ed after your B.E as eligibility for M. Ed in most of the top universities is pass with 50% aggregate marks in B. Ed. So you have to go for B. Ed first and then you can go for m. Ed. Eligibility for B.ed in most of the top universities is Pass with 55% aggregate marks in B.Tech. or B.E. with specialization in Science and Mathematics, rest it may vary with the university you choose. Benefits of doing B.ed are that you can work as: Secondary school teachers, Educational Counsellors, Educational Entrepreneurs, School Administrators, Free lancers, Free Lance Trainers, Instructional Designers etc. You must go for top universities such as: Lovely Professional university- Punjab, Lady Shriram College for Women (LSR) - Delhi, Hansraj College - Delhi, Loyola College - Chennai, St. Joseph's College of Commerce - Bangalore etc. I hope it helps.

You can, and you should! Most educators I know have their master's degrees. Though the pay increase in the districts I have worked in is negligible for the amount of money and time required in this pursuit, as an educator, it is great to have the knowledge acquired through this degree. And it will make you much more marketable when looking for a job.

Yes it is possible. One major consideration: What do you wish to do with the degree? Look the the school boards you want to work in. Meet we th the principal to detect what courses might be of benefit when it comes to hiring.
B.Ed. degree is a pre requisite for M.Ed. Pursuing B.Ed. and M.Ed. after B.E./B.Tech. is waste of time. You may face awkward questions in job interviews.
To do M ED one must have B ED degree. So first do B ED after B E and get admission in M ED
wasting career in m.ed instead do m.tech and become professor
